page.title: 01COOK'S BRIDGE FARM
page.content: Cook's Bridge Farm is a dairy farm, with 132 dairy cattle and 70 beef cattle. The farmer gets up at 6 AM and at 6.30 AM he starts to milk the cows; this usually takes about 2 hours.The milk is collected at 9.00 AM by a tanker from the M.M.B. The farmer does not own the farm;it is owned by the council.4 people work on the farm,they are _the farmer,his son and two workmen. There are six large buildings on the farm,these include the farm house <which was built before Rossett Mill_approx 1500 AD>, two large barns, a milking parlor and a cow shed. The farm has 214 acres of land for grazing and 42 acres for growing barley crops.We saw the cow shed where the in_heifer cows slept.When we went in the cows mooed so noisily that we couldn't hear ourselves speak.
